string.name: findHead
string.br: How to Find the MAC Address of Your Device

resources.string:
1. On your Home screen press the Menu button and Settings.


2. Scroll down to About Device and press Status.


3. Scroll down till you find the Wi-Fi MAC address entry.


4. This is you devices MAC address.


5. Directly below that is your Bluetooth MAC address.

• If you have an emergency warning sign (trouble breathing), seek emergency medical care immediately.


• Stay in a separate room from other household members, if possible.


• Use a separate bathroom, if possible.


• Take steps to improve ventilation at home, if possible.


• Avoid contact with other members of the household and pets.


• Don’t share personal household items, like cups, towels, and utensils.


• Wear a well-fitting mask when you need to be around other people.


• Once you isolate for at least 5 days, if you are fever free and your other symptoms have improved, you can end isolation


• Use an antigen test towards the end of the 5-day isolation period. If your test result is positive, you should continue to isolate until day 10. If your test result is negative, you can end isolation

• Seek emergency medical care immediately.


• Stay in a separate room from other household members, if possible.


• Use a separate bathroom, if possible.


• Take steps to improve ventilation at home, if possible.


• Avoid contact with other members of the household and pets.


• Don’t share personal household items, like cups, towels, and utensils.


• Wear a well-fitting mask when you need to be around other people.


• Once you isolate for at least 10 days, if you are fever free and your other symptoms have improved, you can end isolation


• Use an antigen test towards the end of the 10-day isolation period. If your test result is positive, you should continue to isolate until day 20. If your test result is negative, you can end isolation

• Stay in a separate room from other household members, if possible.


• Use a separate bathroom, if possible.


• Take steps to improve ventilation at home, if possible.


• Avoid contact with other members of the household and pets.


• Don’t share personal household items, like cups, towels, and utensils.


• Wear a well-fitting mask when you need to be around other people.


• Once you isolate for at least 10 days, if you are fever free and your other symptoms have improved, you can end isolation


• If you are unsure if your symptoms are moderate, talk to a healthcare provider for further guidance.

• Stay home and away from other people for at least 5 days.


• Wear a well-fitting mask when around others at home, if possible.


• For 10 days, watch for fever (100.4◦F or greater), cough, shortness of breath, or other COVID-19 symptoms.


• If you develop symptoms, get tested immediately and isolate until you receive your test results. If you test positive, follow isolation recommendations.


• If you do not develop symptoms, get tested at least after 5 days.


• If possible, stay away from people you live with, especially people who are at higher risk for getting very sick from COVID-19, as well as others outside your home throughout the full 10 days.


• Do not go to places where you are unable to wear a mask, such as restaurants and some gyms, and avoid eating around others at home and at work for 10 days.
